description:
Photo by @christmannphoto // Something for the heart

It's hard to tell uplifting stories and spread positivity, when there is so much going wrong in the world at the moment. I am especially sorry for all the people, who are feeling the direct catastrophic impacts of war, losing their loved ones, homes, hope. 

As you know emperor penguins are incredible parents, teaching their offspring the virtues of the colony early on in their lives. It is crucial for the chicks and also the colony's survival. 

I feel the only thing we can do is to teach our kids the crucial virtues of human survival: care for other human beings, care for all living creatures and care for this planet.

Together with other National Geographic photographers, we will be organizing a print sale to help provide medical aid to people displaced or affected by the conflict in Ukraine. I will share details soon. 100% of the profits will go to Direct Relief (https://www.directrelief.org/emergency/ukraine-crisis/)

Let's all hope and pray for peace!

@natgeo @thephotosociety @bbcearth @naturepicturelibrary 
@penguinsofworld @penguinsofig @earthpix @wildlifeplanet @birdsonearth @theantarcticreport @sealegacy

I stand with the people of Ukraine ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¦. To try and raise some money I have released this free pattern of Olek the frog on my website, Ravelry and Ribblr (link in bio). Proudly displaying the colours of Ukraine on his tummy! If you do download this pattern please consider donating whatever you can to the charities listed in the description such as www.directrelief.org. Help out people in need and have a gorgeous squishy friend to show your support! 

#crochet #crochetersofinstagram #crochetlove #crocheted #freepattern #amigurumi #beginnercrochet #amigurumis #amigurumilove #frogandtoad #frog #frogsofinstagram #ukraine #westandwithukraine

Dear Community, 

Our hearts and minds are with Ukraine and those seeking refuge. Weâ€™re feeling deep grief for those suffering. When looking to help with crises, we support the good work at @directrelief. They are working directly with Ukraineâ€™s Ministry of Health and other on-the-ground partners to provide urgently needed medical aid, including emergency response packs intended for first responders, oxygen concentrators, critical care medicines, and much more. Thank you for joining us in supporting Direct Relief. 

Direct Relief has a long history of responding to humanitarian crises, whether those affected are Rohingya refugees or Syrians facing ongoing conflict. The organization also has extensive experience working in Ukraine, to which it has provided more than $26 million in aid over the past six months. Since the war broke out, they have deployed more than 30 tons of medical aid. Learn more and donate: https://www.directrelief.org/emergency/ukraine-crisis/

Shown: Abhaya Mudra - Helps us retain the energy of courage.

Carnival is proud of the diversity and inclusiveness of our team which hail from around the globe. In support of our team members directly impacted by the invasion of Ukraine, Carnival Corporation Chairman Micky Arison has recently pledged $3 million from the Micky and Madeleine Arison Family Foundation.

$1 million will be dedicated to each of the following three organizations working tirelessly to support the people of Ukraine:
 
World Central Kitchen [www.wck.org]
UNICEF [www.unicefusa.org]
Direct Relief [www.directrelief.org]

For those looking to support a deserving organization doing outstanding work, we invite you to consider these organizations. Read the full statement here: bit.ly/3umItq5
